smtp_h.introTxt: The Axis product can be configured to send
smtp_h.events_yesTxt: event and error email messages via SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol).
smtp_h.events_noTxt: an email message via SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) whenever the IP address changes.
smtp_h.serversTxt: Enter the host names or IP addresses for your primary and secondary mail servers in the fields provided. Note that to use host names for mail servers, a DNS server must be specified in the Advanced TCP/IP Settings.
smtp_h.portsTxt: Enter the SMTP server port numbers for the primary and secondary SMTP servers, using values in the range 0-65535. The default value is 25.
smtp_h.authenticationTxt: If your mail server requires authentication, check the box for Use authentication to log in to this server.
smtp_h.userpassTxt: Enter the User Name and Password as provided by your network administrator or ISP (Internet Service Provider).
smtp_h.auth_methodTxt: To ensure that the login procedure is performed as securely as possible when using SMTP authentication, you must define the weakest authentication method allowed. Set the Weakest method allowed to the highest/safest method supported by the mail server. The most secure method is listed last. The options Login and Plain have the same priority.
smtp_h.usePOPTxt: When logging into a POP mail server, enter the host name or IP address of the POP server.
smtp_h.noteTxt: Note: Action rules using SMTP (email) need to be disabled and then enabled for the new SMTP settings to be effective.
smtp_h.senderTxt: The From email address field will be used as the sender for all messages sent by the product.
smtp_h.testTxt: Send test email to - Enter an email address and click the Send button to test that the mail servers are functioning and that the email address is valid.
